title: cellranger_atac_mkfastq
description: Demultiplex raw sequencing data for ATAC experiments

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `/path/to/bcl`. Path of Illumina BCL run folder
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `/path/to/bcl`. Path of Illumina BCL run folder.

csv.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `SampleSheet.csv`. The path to the simple layout sample sheet
csv.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `SampleSheet.csv`. The path to the simple layout sample sheet.

lanes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `1,3`, multiple_sep: `","`. bcl2fastq option
lanes.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `1,3`, multiple_sep: `","`. bcl2fastq option. Semicolon-delimited series of lanes to demultiplex. Use this if you have a sample sheet for an entire flow cell but only want to generate a few lanes for further 10x Genomics analysis.

use_bases_mask.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `y50n,I6n,Y50n`, multiple_sep: `","`. bcl2fastq option
use_bases_mask.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `y50n,I6n,Y50n`, multiple_sep: `","`. bcl2fastq option. Use to clip extra bases off a read if you ran extra cycles for QC.

delete_undetermined.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. bcl2fastq option. Delete the Undetermined FASTQs generated by bcl2fastq. Useful if you are demultiplexing a small number of samples from a large flow cell.

barcode_mismatches.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1`. bcl2fastq option. Use this option to change the number of allowed mismatches per index adapter (0, 1, 2).

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the demux results
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the demux results

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
